data.title: Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights
data.meta_description: The Latest News and Voices for Human Rights Nearly ten years after Michael Brown’s murder by Ferguson police, his family has one last avenue for justice before the Inter-American Commission of Human Rights. The July 10 hearing, which featured remarks from Brown’s mother, Lezley McSpadden, as well as attorneys and activists from Robert F. Kennedy […]
data.text:
Expose injustice. teach change. Shape history. Join us.

We realize Senator Kennedy’s dream of a more just and peaceful world. Learn more

Fix the system. Not just the symptoms

Explore our work in Domestic and International Justice.

Learn more

inequality is by design. Change must be too.

Explore our work in Business & Human Rights. Learn more

What’s not taught isn’t learned. Teach human rights.

Explore our work in Human Rights Education. Learn more

The Latest

News and Voices for Human Rights

We advocate for human rights issues and pursue strategic litigation to hold governments accountable at home and around the world. We foster a social good approach to business, celebrate agents of change, and to ensure change that lasts, we educate millions of students about human rights, training the next generation of leaders.

Justice

Working alongside grassroots partners, our teams of lawyers confront systemic problems through litigation and advocacy aimed at structural change.

Explore Our Programs

Business

We work within our network, which includes some of the world’s most powerful fiduciaries, to push investors and corporations to integrate dignity and equity into their business approach, across people, practices, portfolios, and community impacts.

Education

We envision a world where human rights education is ingrained into the fabric of all educators’ pedagogy and young people are empowered to become human rights defenders.

Explore Our Programs
